alert.note: Alert for Toombs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:56PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Toombs County through 630 PM EDT... At 556 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from New Branch to near Plant Hatch, and moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Toombs County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern Georgia.
